If one cultivates the perfection of generosity without dedicating it to omniscience, can it be called the true cultivation of the perfection of generosity?

Because this perfection of wisdom is the most honored and leading among those perfections of giving, morality, patience, vigor, and meditation, I only extensively praise the perfection of wisdom.

One must dedicate to omniscience and abide in external emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of non-existence in order to be called true abiding in external emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of non-existence.
This prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is the honored one and the guide for those inner emptinesses up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, therefore I extensively praise prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ alone.

One must dedicate to omniscience and abide in suchness in order to be called true abiding in suchness.

It is only by dedicating to omniscience and abiding in the dharma realm up to the inconceivable element that it can be called truly abiding in the dharma realm up to the inconceivable element.
Therefore, this prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is the honored one and the guide for those true suchnesses up to the inconceivable element, and so I am extensively praising prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

One must dedicate to omniscience and abide in the noble truth of suffering in order to be called truly abiding in the noble truth of suffering.

If one does not dedicate to omniscience and abides in the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path, can it be called true abiding in the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path?

One must dedicate to omniscience and abide in the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path in order to be called truly abiding in the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path.

One must cultivate the four concentrations while dedicating them to omniscience in order for it to be called the true cultivation of the four concentrations.

Therefore, this prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is the guide and leader of those four meditations, four immeasurables, and four formless concentrations, and so I am extensively praising prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ alone.
If one does not dedicate to omniscience in cultivating the eight liberations, can it be called truly cultivating the eight liberations?
One must dedicate to omniscience in order to cultivate the eight liberations, only then can it be called truly cultivating the eight liberations.

If one does not dedicate the cultivation of the eight liberations, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases to omniscience, can it be called the true cultivation of the eight liberations, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases?

It is only by dedicating the cultivation of the eight liberations, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases to omniscience that it can be called the true cultivation of the eight liberations, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases.

Because this prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is the honored one and the guide for those eight liberations, eight successive concentrations, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases, I am only extensively praising prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

It is only by dedicating to the wisdom of omniscience and cultivating the signless, wishless liberation gates that it can be called the true cultivation of the signless, wishless liberation gates.

One must dedicate the six supernormal powers to omniscience in order to truly cultivate the six supernormal powers.

One must dedicate to omniscience and cultivate the ten powers of a Buddha in order to be called true cultivation of the ten powers of a Buddha.

If one does not dedicate to omniscience and cultivates the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a Buddha, can it be called true cultivation of the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a Buddha?

One must cultivate the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great loving-kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha while dedicating them to omniscience in order to truly cultivate the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great loving-kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha.

If one does not dedicate it to the wisdom of omniscience but cultivates the nature of constant abiding and abandonment, can it be called the true cultivation of the nature of constant abiding and abandonment?
One must cultivate the nature of constant abiding and abandonment by dedicating it to the wisdom of omniscience in order to truly cultivate the nature of constant abiding and abandonment.
Therefore, I only extensively praise prajna paramita because it is the most revered and leading factor for the power of non-forgetfulness and the nature of constant abiding and abandonment.
If one does not dedicate to omniscience and cultivates omniscience, can it be called the true cultivation of omniscience?
One must dedicate to omniscience and cultivate omniscience in order to be called the true cultivation of omniscience.

If one does not dedicate to omniscience and cultivates the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects, can it be called the true cultivation of the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects?

One must dedicate to omniscience and cultivate the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects in order to be called the true cultivation of the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects.

One must cultivate the practice of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas while dedicating it to the wisdom of omniscience in order to truly cultivate the practice of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas.
Because this prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is the honored one and the guide for the practice of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, I have extensively praised prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
If one cultivates unsurpassed perfect enlightenment without dedicating it to omniscience, can it be called the true cultivation of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?
It is only by dedicating it to omniscience that one can cultivate unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and it can then be called the true cultivation of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. Therefore,
this prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is the honored one and the guide for that unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and so I have extensively praised prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
The Venerable PramuditarÄja then addressed the Buddha, saying:
How does one dedicate to omniscience while cultivating the perfection of generosity?

Cultivating the perfection of generosity with non-duality as the skillful means, non-arising as the skillful means, and non-attainment as the skillful means, this is called dedicating to omniscience while cultivating the perfection of generosity.
How does one dedicate to omniscience while cultivating the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom?

Cultivating the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom with non-duality as the skillful means, non-arising as the skillful means, non-attainment as the skillful means, this is called dedicating to omniscience while cultivating the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom.
How does one dedicate to omniscience while abiding in inner emptiness?

SubhÅ«ti, using non-duality as the means, non-arising as the means, and non-attainment as the means, to abide in inner emptiness, this is called dedicating to omniscience while abiding in inner emptiness.

World-Honored One, how does one dedicate to omniscience while abiding in outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of non-dispersal, emptiness of non-disturbance, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence?ğŸ”½SubhÅ«ti,
Here is the corrected and aligned text:

Using nonduality as a method, non-arising as a method, and non-attainment as a method, to abide in external emptiness up to the emptiness of intrinsic nature, this is called dedicating to omniscience while abiding in external emptiness up to the emptiness of intrinsic nature.
How does one dedicate to omniscience while abiding in suchness?
Using nonduality as a method, non-arising as a method, and non-attainment as a method, to abide in suchness, this is called dedicating to omniscience while abiding in suchness.

How does one dedicate to omniscience while abiding in the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, unarisen nature, dharma determination, dharma abiding, reality limit, space element, and inconceivable element?

Using nonduality as a method, non-arising as a method, and the absence of attainment as a method, to abide in the dharma realm and up to the inconceivable realm, this is called dedicating to omniscience while abiding in the dharma realm and up to the inconceivable realm.
How does one dedicate to omniscience while abiding in the noble truth of suffering?

Using nonduality as a method, non-arising as a method, and the absence of attainment as a method, to abide in the noble truth of suffering, this is called dedicating to omniscience while abiding in the noble truth of suffering.
How does one dedicate to omniscience while abiding in the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and the path?

Using nonduality as a method, non-arising as a method, and the absence of attainment as a method, to abide in the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and the path, this is called dedicating to omniscience while abiding in the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and the path.
How does one dedicate the cultivation of the four meditations to the wisdom of omniscience?

Using non-duality as the method, non-arising as the method, and non-attainment as the method to cultivate the four meditations is called dedicating the cultivation of the four meditations to the wisdom of omniscience.
How does one dedicate the cultivation of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations to the wisdom of omniscience?

Using non-duality as the method, non-arising as the method, and non-attainment as the method to cultivate the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations is called dedicating the cultivation of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations to the wisdom of omniscience.
How does one dedicate the cultivation of the eight liberations to the wisdom of omniscience?

Using nonduality as the method, non-arising as the method, and non-attainment as the method, to cultivate the eight liberations, this is called dedicating to omniscience while cultivating the eight liberations.
How does one dedicate to omniscience while cultivating the eight bases of mastery, the nine sequential attainments, and the ten universal bases?

Using nonduality as the method, non-arising as the method, and non-attainment as the method, to cultivate the eight bases of mastery, the nine sequential attainments, and the ten universal bases, this is called dedicating to omniscience while cultivating the eight bases of mastery, the nine sequential attainments, and the ten universal bases.
How does one dedicate to omniscience while cultivating the four establishments of mindfulness?

Using nonduality as the method, non-arising as the method, and the absence of attainment as the method, to cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness, this is called dedicating to omniscience while cultivating the four establishments of mindfulness.
How does one dedicate to omniscience while cultivating the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path?

Using nonduality as the method, non-arising as the method, and the absence of attainment as the method, to cultivate the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path, this is called dedicating to omniscience while cultivating the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path.
How does one dedicate to omniscience while cultivating the emptiness liberation gate?

Using nonduality as the method, non-arising as the method, and non-attainment as the method, to cultivate the emptiness liberation gate, this is called dedicating to omniscience while cultivating the emptiness liberation gate.
